chapter.title: Titles
chapter.para: Title styles differ depending on where they are used.

listitem.para: For a book, use a title that provides enough context. For example, &ib; technical documentation style guide clarifies that the style guide is about technical documentation rather than legal documentation, and &ib; specifies that it is derived from Infobits rather than another entity.

For a chapter or section, use a title that provides enough context without being redundant. In a chapter titled Lists, for example, use Ordered and Unordered rather than Ordered list and Unordered list.

For procedure titles, use a gerund (also known as a verb with an -ing ending), such as Writing in the example that follows. Doing so keeps the procedure name short, and distinguishes the name of a procedure from its steps that are in the imperative form.

chapter.title: Organization
chapter.para: It is often easier to organize a document after you have ample content. "Let the data do the organizing."

section.title: Chapter or section
section.para: If you chunk information into smaller parts, introduce the set of smaller parts with a sentence or paragraph. If you find it difficult to write that introduction, your organizational structure might be bloated; you might have a section or subsection that you can remove.

chapter.title: Lists
chapter.para: If you use a list, include more than one list item. If you only have one list item, remove the list and rephrase the information using one or two sentences. Doing so removes unnecessary structure. Use only one type of list at a time; avoid * foo: A tool that ..., where * signifies an unordered list and : signifies a definition list.

section.title: Definition
section.para: Use an definition (or variable) list for complementary information that includes a term and a definition.

section.title: Ordered
section.para: Use an ordered (or numbered) list for information that needs to be performed in a particular order. If only part of the list needs to be performed in a particular order, write a default order that you want your reader to use.

section.title: Unordered
section.para: Use an unordered (or bulleted) list for information that does not need to be performed in a particular order.
